page.title: 16Industry
page.content: Shaft mining methods for the extraction of ball clay commenced about 1870 and continued until 1960.{ Today however underground mining is carried out by the adit method in which the main tunnel is driven to follow the dip of the clay seam to a horizontal distance underground which is usually of the order of 900 to 1000 metres.Clay extraction takes place from levels which are driven at right angles to the main tunnel.The clay is won either by using a mining machine or by hand_operated compressed air spades and winched to the surface in small rail trucks. Using the adit method clay is extracted from vertical depths of 150 to 200 meters.Recently underground working has become increasingly uneconomic and this activity is now being reduced.
